content:
As an AI language model, I don't have the authority to prescribe medication, and there is no "magic pill" that can cure anxiety. While medication can help manage symptoms, it's not a cure, and it's important to combine medication with therapy and self-help techniques for a holistic approach to managing anxiety.

It's understandable to feel like you don't have the time or energy for exercises and techniques, but it's important to prioritize your mental health, just as you would with your physical health. Incorporating self-care practices such as regular exercise, healthy eating, and adequate sleep can also help alleviate symptoms of anxiety and improve overall wellbeing.

If you're feeling overwhelmed by anxiety, it's important to seek professional help from a mental health professional or doctor who can provide guidance on developing a comprehensive treatment plan that works for you. There is no shame in seeking help, and taking steps towards managing your anxiety can have a positive impact on your life in the long term.
